intro: Commelina somalensis, commonly known as the Somali dayflower, is a flowering plant native to Somalia and parts of East Africa. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family, which includes many grass-like plants and ornamental species. The plant features striking blue or violet flowers with white markings, typically blooming during the rainy season. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often growing in dense clusters near the ground. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates.
